section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to establish a requirement for development of fire safety plans and a vehicle safety program for the Institution, including State Use Industries.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Evacuation" means to move inmates and staff from a threatened area of fire or hazard of fire.
"Fire plan" means the plan of evacuation, security, first aid, and firefighting for the institution.
"Fire safety" means policy and procedure which ensures the Institution's safety from fire hazards.
"Fleet safety coordinator" means a person who is the assigned representative in each motor vehicle safety activity.
"Inmate" means an eligible person, as defined in COMAR 12.12.01.03B(9).
"Motor vehicle" means a device which transports a person or property.
"State vehicle" means a motor vehicle titled or leased to the State.
"Support agency" means:
A utility company;
An emergency medical service;
A law enforcement agency;
The Division of Correction;
Another agency which may assist the Institution in case of fire; or
An organization, business, or firm involved by a grant or contract.
The Director shall ensure that the Warden develops procedures to establish a fire plan in conjunction with the Fire Marshal of the locality.
The Director shall ensure that the Warden appoints a fire safety officer who has completed a qualified fire safety program.
The Director shall ensure that the fire plan includes the following elements:
Inspection by the fire safety officer of the Institution on a monthly basis with required documentation sent to the Warden;
Annual review and revision as needed;
Availability of the plan to staff;
Posting of the fire plan in designated areas;
Establishment of teams to conduct firefighting, evacuation, security, and first aid;
Fire stations for individual extinguishers;
Teams for each extinguishing device;
Conduct of quarterly fire drills which meet the following criteria:
Under varying conditions,
On a staggered basis,
On random days,
At random times, and
On all shifts;
Evacuation procedures associated with the conduct of a fire drill which considers security requirements and public safety;
Establishment of an ongoing relationship with the local fire department to ensure:
Understanding of community emergency service capabilities by Institution administration and staff, and
Ongoing communication and coordination;
Provision for good housekeeping standards within the Institution;
Requirement for constant vigilance by staff to detect and eliminate fire hazards;
Development of a master list of each Institution fire extinguisher which includes the following provisions:
Monitoring extinguisher charge levels,
Recharging or filling of an extinguisher, and
Replacement of an extinguisher which is being repaired with a fully charged, operational extinguisher;
Testing of each alarm system by the fire safety officer on a quarterly basis with requirement for maintenance of appropriate documentation;

Immediate notification of any fire of significance to the Office of the Secretary and when the fire department is summoned to the Institution, the Warden shall ensure that Office of the Secretary personnel are notified in the following manner:
The Assistant Secretary during normal business hours, or
The Department Public Information Officer during hours other than those set for normal business;
Establishment of a contingency plan, coordinated with all participants, for transferring inmates to alternate facilities under emergency conditions;
Mandatory training requirements for each employee to ensure understanding of the fire safety plan; and
Establishment of a list of support agencies which will be reviewed and updated annually.
The Director shall ensure that each employee acknowledges awareness of the Institution fire plan for the employee's place of employment.

The Director shall ensure that when a fire or other emergency occurs within the Institution and the estimate of damage exceeds $1,000, the Warden submits a written report to the Office of the Secretary and the Maryland State Treasurer, Insurance Division, within 5 working days.
The Director shall reasonably ensure that each inmate is made aware of the Institution's fire response plan for inmates.

When a fire drill is conducted, the Director shall ensure that the entire inmate population is not evacuated at one time. Sections of the Institution may be evacuated to other sections of the Institution.
The Warden may simulate fire drill evacuations under conditions in which evacuation would not jeopardize Institution safety and control.
The Director shall ensure that procedures for establishment of a vehicle safety program are based on requirements contained in the following:
Maryland State Vehicle Fleet Policies and Procedures as published by the Department of Budget and Fiscal Planning; and
The Governor's State Fleet Safety Committee Handbook.

The Director shall ensure that a fleet safety coordinator is designated for the Institution. The Director shall ensure that the fleet safety coordinator implements requirements included within the Governor's State Fleet Safety Committee Handbook.
The Director shall ensure that the Warden establishes a preventive maintenance program for each vehicle.

The Director shall develop and implement an emergency preparedness program for major emergencies which may affect the safety and security of the Institution. The program shall include procedures for the following:
Establishment of command responsibility;
Isolation, containment, and control of the emergency situation; and
Reestablishment of normal operational order following resolution of the emergency situation.
An emergency preparedness program shall ensure the personal safety for each of the following:
Visitors;
Civilian and security staff; and
Inmates.
The Director shall ensure that the occurrence of a major emergency included within the emergency preparedness plan is documented in accordance with Institution regulations.

The Director shall ensure that the emergency preparedness program plan is coordinated with, and communicated to, allied agencies which may be called upon for assistance during Institution emergency conditions.
The Director shall ensure that Institution staff receive training on the emergency preparedness program plan.
When a group of inmates is being transported, and one or more of the inmates in the group is not on conditional release status, the Warden shall ensure that the shift commander:
Transports the inmates in a secured vehicle;
Determines the number of correctional officers assigned to escort duty and authorizes the appropriate weapons to be carried;
Restrains the inmates in accordance with Institution directives; and
Assigns to escort duty at least one correctional officer of the same sex as the inmates being transported.

When transporting a group of inmates that includes only inmates on conditional release status, the shift commander may transport the inmates without restraints, using on-duty staff other than correctional officers.
The Warden shall ensure that a correctional officer assigned to escort duty:
Is qualified in the use of firearms, trained and experienced in transporting inmates, familiar with good security practices, and possesses an appropriate vehicle operator's permit;
Provides supervision to a probationary correctional officer who is assigned to escort duty;

Obtains from the Institution control center an escort identification card for an inmate to be transported, and returns the card to the Institution control center when the inmate is returned to the Institution;
Ensures that restraint devices remain on an inmate while in a courtroom unless the presiding judge or magistrate orders otherwise;
Obtains a written receipt for an inmate who is left in the custody of a law enforcement or other authorized agency; and
While escorting an inmate being treated at or admitted to an outside medical facility:
Notifies medical facility security personnel when an inmate arrives at a medical facility,
Ensures that restraint devices remain on an inmate while in a medical facility, unless a health care provider, due to medical circumstances, directs otherwise,
Maintains an inmate in view at all times, unless an inmate's medical treatment makes this impossible, in which case the officer shall assume a position as close to the inmate as possible,
Ensures that an inmate only receives items which have been approved by the Institution or medical facility staff,
Ensures that an inmate is allowed to make a telephone call only when the Warden or designee has granted specific written permission,
Ensures that a visit an inmate receives is in accordance with COMAR 12.12.18, Institution directives, and medical facility policies concerning clinical and security issues, and
Ensures that an inmate is allowed only in an authorized area of a medical facility.
